Representative_Docs: ['Diane Rae Gunter Birth: 1939 Death: 2025 Diane Rae Gunter, 86, passed on November 2, 2025 at her home in Soquel surrounded by family. She is survived by her daughter, son, grandchildren, and great grandchildren and is pre-deceased by her husband. Diane taught swimming to children for many years at Polly‚Äôs Puddle and spent her career working in a sheltered workshop for disabled adults in Oregon. She was an avid tennis and softball player early in life, and she found her love for golf later. She spent much of her time in her garden, often ending the day with a pint of her favorite Guinness. She enjoyed traveling and spending time with family and friends. Diane lived her life on her terms and will be missed by all. Representative_Docs: ['Asking Eric: Family, friends don‚Äôt seem to appreciate time I put into tedious Christmas cookie tradition Dear Eric: My late mother made a special Christmas cookie that required tedious decorating, considering each person‚Äôs personal preference for toppings, and giving them as gifts to family and friends. They always had a place of honor on our family Christmas table. When she was no longer able, she gave me the cookie cutter, and my daughters and I took over the family tradition. It takes the three of us several days to make, bake, decorate, package and mail cookies to family members around the country. We enjoy doing it and feel like we‚Äôre continuing the fun and festive tradition. However, in recent years, not all of the recipients acknowledge receipt. At some point in their lives, they have all helped Grandma decorate, so they know the time involved. Because of past delivery issues, I track the boxes and inquire if I haven‚Äôt heard from them in a couple of days. Last year, one response was ‚Äúyes we got them.‚Äù This feels unappreciative! In the past most would text a picture of their children with the cookies, which we really enjoyed. We rarely see any of them anymore, as they are busy raising their families and don‚Äôt live nearby. Our daughter-in-law has made special plans for him and we are not included. I understand that, but I need some ideas as to how to celebrate this extra special year without rocking the boat. The shade defined as a black that reflects less than 0.5 percent of the light that hits it, is used on everything from telescopes to cameras. To find a better way to reproduce this cool color, a team at Cornell University looked to nature. Specifically, a bird called the magnificent riflebird. The magnificent riflebird is a large songbird and member of the bird-of-paradise family found in New Guinea and Australia. The spokesperson did not say who could be behind the shooting, and did not provide immediate information about Alekseyev\'s condition.
